---
title: gensx env create
description: Create a new GenSX environment
---

# gensx env create

The `gensx env create` command creates a new environment in your GenSX project. Environments allow you to manage different deployment configurations (like development, staging, and production) for your workflows.

## Usage

```bash
gensx env create <name> [options]
```

## Arguments

| Argument | Description                                                                                |
| -------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| `<name>` | Name of the environment to create (e.g., "dev", "staging", "production"). |

## Options

| Option                  | Description                                                                  |
| ----------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| `-p, --project <name>`  | Project name to create the environment in.                                    |
| `--set-default`         | Set this environment as the default for the project.                         |
| `-h, --help`            | Display help for the command.                                                |

## Description

This command:

1. Creates a new environment in your specified project
2. Optionally sets it as the default environment
3. Allows you to manage different configurations for your workflows

After creating an environment, you can:
- Select it using `gensx env select`
- Deploy workflows to it using `gensx deploy --env`
- Run workflows in it using `gensx run --env`

## Examples

```bash
# Create a development environment
gensx env create dev

# Create a production environment in a specific project
gensx env create production --project my-app

# Create and set as default environment
gensx env create staging --set-default
```

## Notes

- You must be logged in to GenSX Cloud to create environments (`gensx login`)
- Environment names should be descriptive and follow a consistent naming convention
- Each project can have multiple environments
- Only one environment can be the default at a time
- Environment names are case-sensitive
